abstract.text: A bindings-compatible controller that manages a tree of objects.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: class provides selection and sort management. Its primary purpose is to act as the controller when binding
instances to a hierarchical collection of objects. The root content object of the tree can be a single object, or an array of objects.
object requires that you describe how the tree of objects is traversed by specifying the key-path for child objects specified by

. All child objects for the tree must be key-value coding compliant for the same child key path. If necessary, you should add properties to your model classes that map the child key name to the appropriate class-specific property name.
Child objects can implement a count method (specified to the tree controller using

) that, if provided, returns the number of child objects available. Your model objects are expected to update the value of the count key path in a key-value observing compliant method. Optionally, you can also provide a leaf key path using
that specifies a key in your model object that returns
if the object is a leaf node, and

if it is not. Changes to the leaf node value of the child object should be made in a key-value observing compliant manner. Providing the leaf node key path can improve performance, because it prevents the
from having to examine the child object to determine if it is a leaf node.
For more information about using NSTreeController in your app, see

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An interface that displays a hierarchically organized list of data items that can be navigated and selected.
A set of methods that controllers can implement to enable an editor view to inform the controller when it has uncommitted changes.
A controller that can manage an object’s properties referenced by key-value paths.
A view that uses a row-and-column format to display hierarchical data like directories and files that can be expanded and collapsed.
A bindings-compatible controller that manages a tree of objects.
Adds an object to the tree controller’s content after the current selection.
Adds a child object to the currently selected item.
Adds the objects at the specified
in the tree controller’s content to the current selection.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the tree controller always returns the multiple values marker when multiple objects are selected, even if the selected items have the same value.
The tree controller’s sorted content objects.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the tree controller requires the content array to attempt to maintain a selection at all times, avoiding an empty selection.
A Boolean value that indicates if a child object can be added to the tree controller’s content.
A Boolean value that indicates if an object can be inserted into the tree controller’s content.
A Boolean value that indicates if a child object can be inserted into the tree controller’s content.
The key path used to find the children in the tree controller’s objects.
Returns the key path used to find the children in the specified tree node.
The tree controller’s content object.
The key path used to find the number of children for a node.
Returns the key path that provides the number of children for a specified node.
Creates a new object of the class specified by
and inserts it into the tree controller’s content.
Inserts
into the tree controller’s arranged objects array at the location specified by
, and adds it to the tree controller’s content.
Inserts
into the tree controller’s arranged objects array at the locations specified in
, and adds them to the tree controller’s content.
Creates a new object of the class specified by
and inserts it into the tree controller’s content as a child of the current selection.
The key path used by the tree controller to determine if a node is a leaf key.
Returns the key path that specifies whether the node is a leaf node.
Moves the specified tree nodes to the new index path.
Moves the specified tree node to the new index path.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the tree controller will attempt to preserve the current selection when the content changes.
Use this method to trigger reordering of the tree controller’s content.
Removes the tree controller’s selected objects from the content.
Removes the object at the specified
in the tree controller’s arranged objects from the tree controller’s content.
Removes the objects at the specified
in the tree controller’s arranged objects from the tree controller’s content.
Removes the objects at the specified
from the tree controller’s current selection, returning
if the selection was changed.
An array containing the tree controller’s selected tree nodes.
An array containing the currently selected objects in the tree controller’s content.
The index path of the first selected object.
An array containing the index paths of the currently selected objects.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the tree controller automatically selects objects as they are inserted.
Sets the tree controller’s current selection.
Sets the tree controller’s current selection to the specified index paths.
An array containing the sort descriptors used to arrange the tree controller’s content.
A node in a tree of nodes.
Build a structured user interface that simplifies navigation in your app.

A true value.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
